noun.description: A combination of statements, ideas, or features of a situation that are opposed to one another.
examples: the proposed new system suffers from a set of internal contradictions

phrases: “true fiction” is a contradiction in terms
The very idea of empowerment through cultural heritage is a contradiction in terms.
To others, it can only be a contradiction in terms.
The idea of a real Englishman is almost a contradiction in terms, like talking about a real theme park or a real golf club.
Am I the only one who sees the contradiction in terms here?
origin: Late Middle English: via Old French from Latin contradictio(n-), from the verb contradicere (see contradict).
